metadata.description: Curated UAE Corporate Tax RAG Test Dataset

curation_guide.how_to_add: Add new questions to the questions array with status=draft
curation_guide.how_to_update: Modify questions in place, update last_reviewed date

questions.query: What is the corporate tax rate for businesses in the UAE?
What does Article 50 say about the General Anti-Abuse Rule (GAAR)?
What are the transfer pricing documentation requirements?
questions.ground_truth: Master file and local file required for related party transactions

source_documents.filename: Requirements for Maintaining Transfer Pricing Docu.pdf

questions.query: What are the conditions for participation exemption?
questions.ground_truth: Minimum 5% ownership for 12+ months in entity subject to 9%+ tax

source_documents.filename: Exempt Income_ Dividends and Participation Exempti.pdf

questions.query: What is the small business relief threshold and who qualifies?
What are the requirements for a Qualifying Free Zone Person?
What are the conditions for forming a tax group?
What are the administrative penalties for corporate tax violations?
How is tax residency determined for a juridical person in the UAE?
What expenses are non-deductible under UAE corporate tax?
What are the interest deduction limitation rules?
What are the qualifying activities for free zone persons?
What are the registration timelines for taxable persons?

source_documents.filename: Registration Timelines for Taxable Persons for Cor.pdf

questions.primary_document: Registration Timelines for Taxable Persons for Cor.pdf

questions.query: How are natural persons taxed under the corporate tax?
What are the business restructuring relief provisions?
What is the treatment of foreign source income?
What are the requirements for qualifying investment funds?
How are partnerships taxed under the UAE corporate tax?
What are the conditions for real estate investment trust exemption?

source_documents.filename: Conditions to Exempt Certain Real Estate Investmen.pdf

questions.primary_document: Conditions to Exempt Certain Real Estate Investmen.pdf

questions.query: What is the definition of related parties for transfer pricing?

source_documents.filename: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.primary_document: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.query: What are the qualifying group relief provisions?
What are the requirements for public benefit entity exemption?
How are permanent establishments taxed?
What are the corporate tax return filing requirements?
What accounting standards apply for UAE corporate tax?
What are the transitional rules adjustments for corporate tax?
How is taxable income calculated under UAE corporate tax?
What are the requirements for tax deregistration?
What is the treatment of dividends under UAE corporate tax?

source_documents.filename: Exempt Income_ Dividends and Participation Exempti.pdf

questions.primary_document: Exempt Income_ Dividends and Participation Exempti.pdf

questions.query: What are the extractive business taxation rules?
What is the standard corporate tax rate in the UAE?
questions.ground_truth: 9% for taxable income exceeding AED 375,000, 0% below

questions.query: When did UAE Corporate Tax come into effect?
questions.ground_truth: Financial years starting on or after 1 June 2023

questions.query: What is the small business relief threshold?
questions.ground_truth: Revenue of AED 3 million or less

questions.query: Who is exempt from corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Government entities, public benefit entities, pension funds, investment funds

source_documents.filename: Provisions of Exemption from Corporate Tax.pdf

questions.primary_document: Provisions of Exemption from Corporate Tax.pdf

questions.query: What is a Taxable Person?
questions.ground_truth: A Resident or Non-Resident Person subject to Corporate Tax

questions.query: What transfer pricing methods are acceptable under UAE CT?
questions.ground_truth: CUP, resale price, cost plus, TNMM, profit split methods

questions.query: What is the arm's length principle?
questions.ground_truth: Transactions must be priced as if between independent parties

questions.query: When is a transfer pricing disclosure form required?
questions.ground_truth: Required when related party transactions exceed specified thresholds

questions.query: How do transfer pricing rules interact with tax group transactions?
questions.ground_truth: Intra-group transactions are eliminated for consolidation but TP documentation may still be required

questions.query: What conditions must be met to be a Qualifying Free Zone Person?
questions.ground_truth: Must maintain adequate substance, derive qualifying income, have audited financials

questions.query: What is the tax rate for Qualifying Free Zone Persons?
questions.ground_truth: 0% on qualifying income, 9% on non-qualifying income

questions.query: What are qualifying activities for Free Zone Persons?
questions.ground_truth: Manufacturing, processing, holding shares, logistics, and other specified activities

questions.query: What are excluded activities for Free Zone Persons?
questions.ground_truth: Banking, insurance, retail to mainland consumers, certain regulated activities

questions.query: What is the difference between qualifying and non-qualifying income for Free Zone Persons?
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying income taxed at 0%, non-qualifying at 9%

source_documents.filename: Determining Qualifying Income for the Qualifying F.pdf

questions.query: Can a Free Zone Person elect to be taxed at the standard rate?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, a Free Zone Person can irrevocably elect to be taxed at 9%

questions.query: A Free Zone company provides consulting to both Free Zone and mainland clients. How is its income taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Income from Free Zone clients may be qualifying (0%), mainland income is non-qualifying (9%)

source_documents.filename: Determining Qualifying Income for the Qualifying F.pdf

questions.query: What is the ownership requirement to form a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: Parent must own at least 95% of subsidiary

questions.query: What are all the conditions for forming a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: 95% ownership, both must be UAE resident, same financial year, same accounting currency

source_documents.filename: Conditions for Forming the Tax Group by Subsidiari.pdf

questions.query: How are intra-group transactions treated in a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: Intra-group transactions are eliminated in consolidated tax return

questions.query: Can a Free Zone Person be part of a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: A Qualifying Free Zone Person cannot be part of a Tax Group

questions.query: How do you apply to form a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: Submit application to FTA with required documentation

questions.query: Company A owns 97% of Company B, and Company B owns 98% of Company C. Can all three form a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: A-B qualifies (97%), B-C qualifies (98%), A-C indirect ownership is 97% x 98% = 95.06% so all three can form a group

questions.query: Are dividends from UAE companies exempt from corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, dividends from UAE resident companies are generally exempt

source_documents.filename: Exempt Income_ Dividends and Participation Exempti.pdf

questions.primary_document: Exempt Income_ Dividends and Participation Exempti.pdf

questions.query: What is the participation exemption for capital gains?
questions.ground_truth: Capital gains on qualifying participations are exempt from CT

questions.query: How does participation exemption apply to foreign subsidiaries?
questions.ground_truth: Foreign participations qualify if subsidiary is subject to at least 9% tax

source_documents.filename: Participation Exemption and Foreign Permanent Esta.pdf

questions.primary_document: Participation Exemption and Foreign Permanent Esta.pdf

questions.query: What is the penalty for late tax registration?
questions.ground_truth: Specific penalty amount for late registration under the Penalties Decision

questions.query: What are the penalties for late filing of tax returns?
questions.ground_truth: Penalties for late filing vary by duration of delay

questions.query: What is the penalty for providing incorrect information?
questions.ground_truth: Penalty based on tax amount affected or fixed amount

questions.query: What violations can lead to tax evasion charges?
questions.ground_truth: Intentional misrepresentation, fraud, or concealment of taxable income

questions.query: What is the interest deduction limitation rule?
questions.ground_truth: Net interest expense limited to 30% of EBITDA

source_documents.filename: the General Interest Deduction Limitation Rule.pdf

questions.query: Is there a de minimis threshold for interest deduction limitation?
questions.ground_truth: De minimis threshold of AED 12 million net interest expense

questions.query: Can excess interest expense be carried forward?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, disallowed interest can be carried forward for 10 years

questions.query: How does interest deduction work for related party loans?
questions.ground_truth: Related party interest must be at arm's length and subject to general limitation

questions.query: What are all the conditions for small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Revenue under AED 3 million, make election, not a Qualifying Free Zone Person

questions.query: How many years can you claim small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Can be claimed for consecutive tax periods while conditions are met

questions.query: If a business has AED 2.5 million revenue, can it claim small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, AED 2.5 million is below the AED 3 million threshold

questions.query: When is a natural person subject to corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: When conducting business with turnover exceeding AED 1 million

questions.query: What is the turnover threshold for natural persons?
questions.ground_truth: AED 1 million annual turnover threshold

source_documents.filename: Determination of the Amount of Annual Income Subje.pdf

questions.query: How is real estate investment by natural persons taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Personal real estate investment is generally not subject to CT unless conducted as business

source_documents.filename: Real Estate Investment for Natural Persons.pdf

questions.primary_document: Real Estate Investment for Natural Persons.pdf

questions.query: How does a natural person register for corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Register with FTA when business turnover exceeds threshold

questions.query: When is a non-resident person subject to UAE corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: When having a PE in UAE or deriving UAE-sourced income

questions.query: What is a permanent establishment?
questions.ground_truth: A fixed place of business through which business is conducted

source_documents.filename: Determination of a Non-Resident Person_s Nexus in.pdf

questions.query: What creates a nexus for non-residents in the UAE?
questions.ground_truth: PE, UAE-sourced income, or income connected to UAE business

questions.query: What are the conditions for a qualifying investment fund?
questions.ground_truth: Must be regulated, diversified, and meet ownership/management requirements

source_documents.filename: Qualifying Investment Funds and Qualifying Limited.pdf

questions.query: Are investment funds exempt from corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying investment funds are exempt from CT

questions.query: How are investment managers taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Investment managers are taxable on management fees

questions.query: How are Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying REITs can be exempt, distributions may be taxable to investors

source_documents.filename: Taxation of investors in a Real Estate Investment.pdf
Conditions to Exempt Certain Real Estate Investmen.pdf

questions.primary_document: Taxation of investors in a Real Estate Investment.pdf

questions.query: What conditions must a REIT meet for exemption?
questions.ground_truth: Must distribute 80%+ of income, be listed or widely held

source_documents.filename: Conditions to Exempt Certain Real Estate Investmen.pdf

questions.primary_document: Conditions to Exempt Certain Real Estate Investmen.pdf

questions.query: How are partnerships taxed under UAE corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Unincorporated partnerships are tax transparent by default

questions.query: Can a partnership elect to be treated as a taxable person?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, partnerships can elect to be treated as a taxable juridical person

questions.query: How are foreign partnerships treated?
questions.ground_truth: Treatment depends on legal form and election made

questions.query: How is extractive business income taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Extractive businesses under concession continue under existing tax regime

questions.query: What is a Qualifying Public Benefit Entity?
questions.ground_truth: Non-profit entity serving charitable or public benefit purpose

questions.query: Are charities exempt from corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying Public Benefit Entities are exempt

questions.query: What are the conditions for a pension fund to be exempt?
questions.ground_truth: Must be established for employee benefits and meet regulatory requirements

source_documents.filename: Private Pension Funds and Private Social Security.pdf

questions.primary_document: Private Pension Funds and Private Social Security.pdf

questions.query: What is the timeline for corporate tax registration?
questions.ground_truth: Registration required within specified months of becoming taxable

source_documents.filename: Registration Timelines for Taxable Persons for Cor.pdf
The Timeline specified for Registration of Taxable.pdf

questions.primary_document: Registration Timelines for Taxable Persons for Cor.pdf

questions.query: How do juridical persons register for corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Submit application to FTA with required corporate documents

questions.query: Can a business be exempted from tax registration?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, certain exempt persons may apply for registration exemption

questions.query: When is the corporate tax return due?
questions.ground_truth: Within 9 months of end of tax period

questions.query: What must be included in a corporate tax return?
questions.ground_truth: Tax declaration, financial statements, supporting schedules

questions.query: Can the tax return filing deadline be extended?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, extensions may be granted in certain circumstances

source_documents.filename: Postponement of the Deadline to File a Tax Return.pdf

questions.primary_document: Postponement of the Deadline to File a Tax Return.pdf

questions.query: When must a company deregister from corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Within specified period after ceasing to be a taxable person

questions.query: How is tax residency determined for companies?
questions.ground_truth: Based on incorporation in UAE or effective management and control

source_documents.filename: Tax Resident and Tax Residency Certificate.pdf

questions.query: How do I obtain a tax residency certificate?
questions.ground_truth: Apply to FTA with supporting documentation

source_documents.filename: the Issuance of Tax Residency Certificate for the.pdf
Tax Resident and Tax Residency Certificate.pdf

questions.primary_document: the Issuance of Tax Residency Certificate for the.pdf

questions.query: Who is considered a related party?
questions.ground_truth: Persons with common ownership/control or family relationships

source_documents.filename: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.primary_document: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.query: What are the implications of related party transactions?
questions.ground_truth: Must be at arm's length with proper documentation

source_documents.filename: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.primary_document: The definition of _Related Parties_ where there is.pdf

questions.query: What is business restructuring relief?
questions.ground_truth: Tax-neutral treatment for qualifying business transfers and mergers

source_documents.filename: Business Restructuring Relief for Corporate Tax Pu.pdf

questions.query: What conditions must be met for business restructuring relief?
questions.ground_truth: Common ownership, business continuity, UAE resident parties

source_documents.filename: Business Restructuring Relief for Corporate Tax Pu.pdf

questions.primary_document: Business Restructuring Relief for Corporate Tax Pu.pdf

questions.query: What is qualifying group relief?
questions.ground_truth: Allows tax-neutral transfers and loss sharing within a group

source_documents.filename: Transfers Within a Qualifying Group for Corporate.pdf

questions.query: What is the ownership threshold for qualifying group relief?
questions.ground_truth: 75% common ownership required

questions.query: How are tax losses carried forward?
questions.ground_truth: Losses can be carried forward and offset up to 75% of taxable income

questions.query: Is there a time limit for carrying forward losses?
questions.ground_truth: Losses can be carried forward indefinitely

questions.query: What happens to losses when there is a change in ownership?
questions.ground_truth: Loss carry forward may be restricted on significant ownership change

questions.query: What expenses are deductible for corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Expenses incurred wholly and exclusively for business purposes

questions.query: What expenses are not deductible?
questions.ground_truth: Entertainment over limits, personal expenses, fines, bribes

questions.query: Is entertainment expense deductible?
questions.ground_truth: 50% of entertainment expenses are deductible

questions.query: What accounting standards apply for corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: IFRS or IFRS for SMEs as applicable

source_documents.filename: Accounting Standards and Interaction with Corporat.pdf

questions.query: When are audited financial statements required?
questions.ground_truth: Required when revenue exceeds AED 50 million

source_documents.filename: Determination of Categories of Taxable Persons Req.pdf

questions.query: What is the first tax period for a new company?
questions.ground_truth: From date of incorporation to end of first financial year

source_documents.filename: First Tax Period of juridical person.pdf

questions.primary_document: First Tax Period of juridical person.pdf

questions.query: Can a company change its tax period?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, with FTA approval under certain conditions

source_documents.filename: Conditions for Change in Tax Period.pdf

questions.primary_document: Conditions for Change in Tax Period.pdf

questions.query: What are the transitional rules for existing assets?
questions.ground_truth: Assets can be valued at historical cost or market value on transition date

questions.query: What is the General Anti-Abuse Rule?
questions.ground_truth: Allows FTA to counteract arrangements lacking commercial substance made for tax avoidance

questions.query: How is foreign source income taxed?
questions.ground_truth: May be exempt if from PE subject to comparable tax

questions.query: What changes were made by Federal Decree-Law No. 60 of 2023?
questions.ground_truth: Amendments to certain provisions of the original CT law

source_documents.filename: Amending Certain Provisions of the Federal Decree-.pdf

questions.query: Is there a grace period to update tax records?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, grace period provisions exist for updating information

source_documents.filename: Grace period to update information in tax records.pdf

questions.primary_document: Grace period to update information in tax records.pdf

questions.query: What does Cabinet Decision 116 cover?
questions.ground_truth: Implementation details for various CT law provisions

source_documents.filename: Implementation of Certain Provisions Cabinet Decis.pdf

questions.primary_document: Implementation of Certain Provisions Cabinet Decis.pdf

questions.query: A company has AED 1 million taxable income. What is its tax liability?
If EBITDA is AED 10 million and net interest is AED 5 million, what can be deducted?
questions.ground_truth: 30% of AED 10 million = AED 3 million deductible, AED 2 million carried forward

questions.query: Company has AED 400,000 loss last year and AED 600,000 income this year. What is taxable income?
questions.ground_truth: Can offset 75% of AED 600,000 = AED 450,000, but only AED 400,000 loss available. Taxable: AED 200,000

questions.query: What is the difference between Tax Group and Qualifying Group Relief?
questions.ground_truth: Tax Group requires 95% ownership for consolidation; Qualifying Group Relief requires 75% for transfers

questions.query: Compare resident vs non-resident taxation
questions.ground_truth: Residents taxed on worldwide income; non-residents on UAE-sourced income and PE income

questions.query: What is the difference between small business relief and standard taxation?
questions.ground_truth: Small business relief: 0% tax, standard: 9% on income over AED 375,000

questions.query: A UAE holding company owns 60% of a foreign subsidiary. The subsidiary pays dividends. Are they taxable?
questions.ground_truth: If foreign subsidiary subject to 9%+ tax, dividends may qualify for participation exemption

questions.query: A Free Zone company has AED 5 million from Free Zone clients and AED 2 million from mainland. What is its tax?
questions.ground_truth: AED 5 million at 0%, AED 2 million at 9% (minus AED 375,000 threshold = 9% on AED 1.625 million)

source_documents.filename: Determining Qualifying Income for the Qualifying F.pdf

questions.query: Company A wants to transfer assets to Company B (same owner). What relief is available?
questions.ground_truth: May qualify for Business Restructuring Relief or Qualifying Group Relief

questions.query: A non-resident company has a branch in UAE earning AED 2 million. How is it taxed?
questions.ground_truth: Branch is PE, taxed at 9% on income exceeding AED 375,000

questions.query: What if a company has exactly AED 3 million revenue - does it qualify for small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Yes, the threshold is AED 3 million or less, so exactly AED 3 million qualifies

questions.query: What if ownership in Tax Group drops to 94%?
questions.ground_truth: Entity would cease to be part of the Tax Group as minimum is 95%

questions.query: Can a company in liquidation claim small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: May depend on whether it remains a taxable person during liquidation

questions.query: What if a related party loan has 0% interest rate?
questions.ground_truth: Must be adjusted to arm's length rate for tax purposes

questions.query: What is the VAT rate in UAE?
questions.ground_truth: OUT OF SCOPE - VAT is separate from Corporate Tax

questions.query: How do I set up a company in Dubai?
questions.ground_truth: OUT OF SCOPE - Company formation is not Corporate Tax

questions.query: What are UAE labor law requirements?
questions.ground_truth: OUT OF SCOPE - Labor law is not Corporate Tax

questions.query: Write me a business plan
questions.ground_truth: OFF TOPIC - Not tax related

questions.query: What is the income tax rate for individuals in UAE?
questions.ground_truth: CLARIFY - UAE has no personal income tax

questions.query: tax
questions.ground_truth: CLARIFY - Too vague

questions.query: how much?
questions.ground_truth: CLARIFY - Incomplete question

questions.query: what about groups?
questions.ground_truth: CLARIFY - Which aspect of groups?

questions.query: Explain the complete lifecycle of corporate tax compliance from registration to filing
questions.ground_truth: Register with FTA, maintain records, file return within 9 months, pay tax

questions.query: How do Free Zone rules interact with Tax Group rules?
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying Free Zone Persons cannot be part of a Tax Group

questions.query: Explain the relationship between transfer pricing and interest deduction limitation
questions.ground_truth: Related party interest must be arm's length AND subject to 30% EBITDA cap

questions.query: What reliefs are available for corporate restructuring?
questions.ground_truth: Business Restructuring Relief for mergers, Qualifying Group Relief for transfers

source_documents.filename: Transfers Within a Qualifying Group for Corporate.pdf

questions.query: What are all the exemption categories under UAE Corporate Tax?
questions.ground_truth: Government entities, public benefit entities, investment funds, pension funds

source_documents.filename: Provisions of Exemption from Corporate Tax.pdf

questions.primary_document: Provisions of Exemption from Corporate Tax.pdf

questions.query: What documents are needed for corporate tax registration?
questions.ground_truth: Trade license, Emirates ID, corporate documents

source_documents.filename: Determining the Requirements for the Registration.pdf

questions.query: How do I apply for small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Make election in the tax return for the relevant period

questions.query: What is the process to form a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: Submit application to FTA with ownership evidence and consent from all members

source_documents.filename: Conditions for Forming the Tax Group by Subsidiari.pdf

questions.query: How do I appeal a tax assessment?
questions.ground_truth: File objection within specified period, then appeal to Tax Disputes Resolution Committee

questions.query: What are the record keeping requirements?
questions.ground_truth: Keep records for at least 7 years

questions.query: How should a multinational structure its UAE operations to optimize corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Must have substance, comply with TP rules, consider Free Zone benefits

questions.query: What are the anti-avoidance implications of back-to-back loan arrangements?
questions.ground_truth: May be challenged under GAAR if lacking commercial substance

questions.query: How do transitional rules affect a company that had accumulated losses before CT introduction?
questions.ground_truth: Pre-CT losses cannot be carried forward under CT regime

questions.query: When did the UAE Corporate Tax Law come into effect?
questions.ground_truth: The law was issued in 2022 and came into effect for financial years starting on or after 1 June 2023

questions.query: Who is exempt from corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.ground_truth: Government entities, government controlled entities, qualifying public benefit entities, qualifying investment funds, and qualifying pension funds

questions.query: What is a Taxable Person under UAE Corporate Tax?
questions.ground_truth: A Resident Person or Non-Resident Person that is subject to Corporate Tax

questions.query: What does Article 50 say about the General Anti-Abuse Rule?
questions.ground_truth: Article 50 allows the Authority to counteract tax advantages from arrangements that lack commercial substance and have tax avoidance as main purpose

questions.query: Explain Article 34 on Transfer Pricing
questions.ground_truth: Article 34 requires transactions between related parties to be at arm's length prices consistent with transactions between independent parties

questions.query: What are the rules in Article 40 about Tax Groups?
questions.ground_truth: Article 40 allows resident persons to form a Tax Group if parent owns at least 95% of subsidiary and they share the same financial year

questions.query: What does Article 22 say about Exempt Income?
questions.ground_truth: Article 22 exempts dividends and profit distributions from taxable income under certain conditions including ownership thresholds

questions.query: Explain the complete transfer pricing requirements including documentation, methods, and related party definitions
questions.ground_truth: Transfer pricing requires arm's length pricing, maintenance of master file and local file documentation, and specific methods like CUP, resale price, cost plus, TNMM, and profit split

questions.query: How do tax groups work, including formation, consolidation, and exit requirements?
questions.ground_truth: Tax Groups allow consolidated filing, require 95% ownership, same financial year, and have specific rules for joining, leaving, and liability allocation

questions.query: Describe all the penalties and violations under UAE Corporate Tax
questions.ground_truth: Penalties include fines for late registration, late filing, incorrect returns, and tax evasion, with varying amounts based on violation type

questions.query: What is the difference between Resident and Non-Resident Persons for corporate tax?
questions.ground_truth: Resident Persons are those incorporated in UAE or effectively managed there. Non-Residents are taxed on UAE-sourced income and permanent establishments

questions.query: Compare Free Zone Person benefits vs mainland company taxation
questions.ground_truth: Qualifying Free Zone Persons enjoy 0% on qualifying income vs 9% for mainland. They must meet substance requirements and avoid excluded activities

questions.query: What is the difference between deductible and non-deductible expenses?
questions.ground_truth: Deductible expenses must be incurred wholly and exclusively for business. Non-deductible include entertainment exceeding limits, personal expenses, bribes, and fines

questions.query: How do I register for corporate tax in the UAE?
questions.ground_truth: Register with FTA to obtain TRN. Submit application within specified timeline from becoming a Taxable Person

questions.query: What is the process for filing a corporate tax return?
questions.ground_truth: File tax return within 9 months of end of tax period. Include declaration and audited financial statements if required

questions.query: How do I claim small business relief?
questions.ground_truth: Elect for small business relief if revenue is AED 3 million or less. Make election in tax return for applicable period

questions.query: A company has AED 500,000 taxable income. What is its corporate tax liability?
questions.ground_truth: Tax on AED 500,000: 0% on first AED 375,000 = 0, then 9% on remaining AED 125,000 = AED 11,250. Total tax: AED 11,250

questions.query: If a Free Zone company provides services to a mainland company, what tax applies?
questions.ground_truth: Income from transactions with mainland companies may be excluded from qualifying income and subject to 9% tax unless certain conditions are met

questions.query: A parent company owns 90% of a subsidiary. Can they form a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: No, they cannot form a Tax Group. The minimum ownership requirement is 95%, so 90% ownership is insufficient

questions.query: What is the VAT rate in the UAE?
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD NOT ANSWER - VAT is not covered in Corporate Tax Law documents

questions.query: How do I incorporate a company in Dubai?
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD NOT ANSWER - Company incorporation is not covered in Corporate Tax Law

questions.query: What are the personal income tax rates in UAE?
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD CLARIFY - UAE has no personal income tax. Corporate tax applies to businesses, not personal income

questions.query: Can you help me write a Python script?
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD REFUSE - Completely out of scope, not tax related

questions.query: What was the corporate tax rate in UAE in 2020?
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD CLARIFY - UAE had no corporate tax before June 2023 (except for oil companies and foreign banks)

questions.query: tax stuff
questions.ground_truth: SHOULD ASK FOR CLARIFICATION - Too vague to provide meaningful answer

questions.query: what about free zones
questions.ground_truth: May provide general Free Zone information or ask for clarification on specific aspect needed

questions.query: What happens if a company has exactly AED 375,000 taxable income?
questions.ground_truth: If taxable income is exactly AED 375,000 (not exceeding), the tax rate is 0%. Tax only applies to amounts exceeding the threshold

questions.query: What if a company has zero taxable income?
questions.ground_truth: If taxable income is zero, no corporate tax is payable. However, the company may still need to file a tax return

questions.query: What if a company changes its financial year end mid-year?
questions.ground_truth: Changes to financial year may require FTA approval and can affect tax period calculations

questions.query: Can a natural person be in a Tax Group?
questions.ground_truth: No, only juridical persons can form Tax Groups. Natural persons conducting business cannot be part of a Tax Group

questions.query: How does the participation exemption interact with the General Anti-Abuse Rule when structuring a holding company?
questions.ground_truth: Participation exemption benefits may be denied under GAAR if holding structure lacks commercial substance and is primarily for tax avoidance

questions.query: Explain the transitional rules for pre-existing assets and how they interact with depreciation deductions
questions.ground_truth: Pre-existing assets can be valued at historical cost or market value (by election). This affects depreciation base and future deductions

questions.query: What are the implications of Article 51 on anti-abuse for intra-group financing arrangements?
questions.ground_truth: Intra-group financing must be at arm's length and have commercial substance. Anti-abuse provisions may apply if arrangements lack genuine business purpose

questions.query: What are the conditions for Qualifying Free Zone Person status?
questions.ground_truth: Must be registered in Free Zone, maintain adequate substance, derive qualifying income, have audited financials, and not elect to be taxed at 9%

questions.query: How are losses carried forward under UAE Corporate Tax?
questions.ground_truth: Tax losses can be carried forward indefinitely but offset is limited to 75% of taxable income in any given period. Some losses cannot be carried forward upon ownership change

questions.query: What are the conditions for small business relief?
